original_title: Hackaday Prize 2023: LASK4 Watches Those Finger Wiggles
original_content:
What do you get when you combine an ESP32-S2, a machine-learning model, some Hall effect sensors, and a grip exercise toy? [Turfptax] did just that and created LASK4. The four springs push down pistons with tiny magnets on them. Hall effect sensors determine the pistons position, and since the springs are linear, the ESP32 can also estimate the force being applied on a given finger. This data is then streamed to a nearby computer over TCP. A small OLED screen shows the status, and a tidy 3D printed case creates a comfortable package.
So other than an excellent musical instrument, what is this good for? First, it creates well-labeled training data when combined with what is collected by the muscle sensor band we discussed previously. The muscle band measures various pressure sensors radially around the forearm. With just a few minutes of training data, the system can accurately predict finger movement using the random forest regression model.
What would you use it for? Its considered a somatosensory device, so it can be used for physical therapy when undergoing hand rehabilitation, as it provides feedback during sessions. Or it could be used to train a controller efficiently.
Its an exciting project on GitHub under an OpenCERN hardware license. The code is in MicroPython, and the PCB and STL files are included. Were looking forward to seeing what else comes from the project. After the break, theres a progress update video.

title: ESP32-S2を使用した筋力トレーニングデバイス、LASK4を作成！
body: 自作グリップエクササイズ用の装置LASK4を開発。ESP32-S2、機械学習モデル、Hall効果センサ、線形スプリングを組み合わせ、近くのコンピュータにTCPでストリーミングできる。トレーニングデータの収集、指運動の予測などに役立つ。オープンソース。
titles: ESP32-S2を使用した筋力トレーニングデバイス、LASK4を作成！
LASK4を使って、手のリハビリや器具を効率的にトレーニングしよう！
LASK4と筋電義手を使用して、正確な指の動きを予測することができる！
マシンラーニング技術を利用したLASK4は、筋力トレーニングの新しい方法を提供する！
MicroPythonで作成されたLASK4がオープンソースで公開され、自分で作ることができる！
